patient_information: Age: 4 years old Sex: female Location: Bolivia Health status: good general health
chief_complaint: History of several days of a slowly growing nodule on the fifth toe of her right foot that is moderately painful when wearing shoes.
history_of_present_illness: A 4-year-old girl presents with a history of several days of a slowly growing nodule on the fifth toe of her right foot. The lesion is dark brown and has a tiny central ulceration surrounded by minimal inflammatory reaction. The family moved from Chile to the Cochabamba region in Bolivia about 6 months ago.
physical_exam: Lesion description: Dark brown nodule with a tiny central ulceration surrounded by minimal inflammatory reaction Pain on wearing shoes: Moderately painful
management_and_clinical_course: Treatment plan: The parasite should be completely removed using a sterile needle and/or curette. The resulting round lesion must be disinfected and dressed. Outcome: The skin lesion healed within a week without complications.
